meanings.definition: A subatomic particle with integer spin.
meanings.sent1: The boson was smaller than an atom.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the boson to understand its properties.
meanings.sent3: The boson decided to spin around the nucleus for fun.
meanings.sent4: In the world of particles, the boson stood out with its unique spin.
meanings.sent5: The boson's integer spin made it distinct from other particles.

meanings.sent1: An elementary school student asked about the boson in science class.
meanings.sent2: The boson is one of the building blocks of matter.
meanings.sent3: The boson elementary particle was always top of the class.
meanings.sent4: In the universe of particles, the boson shone brightly as an elementary member.
meanings.sent5: Learning about the boson helped the students understand basic particles.

meanings.definition: A particle that follows Bose-Einstein statistics.
meanings.sent1: The boson's behavior followed the Bose-Einstein statistics perfectly.
meanings.sent2: Scientists use the boson to study quantum statistics.
meanings.sent3: The boson loved to play games with statistics, especially Bose-Einstein ones.
meanings.sent4: In the realm of quantum mechanics, the boson danced elegantly with statistics.
meanings.sent5: Understanding the boson's connection to Bose-Einstein statistics is crucial in physics.
